intro: Dilatris corymbosa, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow or orange flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling bells.
